graph_title: Proportion of the rural population who live within 2 km of an all-season road
indicator_name: Proportion of the rural population who live within 2 km of an all-season road
SDG_GOAL: Goal 9: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
SDG_TARGET: Target 9.1: Develop quality, reliable, sustainable and resilient infrastructure, including regional and trans-border infrastructure, to support economic development and human well-being, with a focus on affordable and equitable access for all
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 9.1.1: Proportion of the rural population who live within 2 km of an all-season road
STAT_CONC_DEF: The indicator (commonly known as the Rural Access Index or RAI) measures the share of a country’s rural population that lives within 2 km of an all-season road.
DATA_COMP: The Rural Access Index (RAI) is a percentage calculated by dividing the rural population within 2 kilometres of the road network (with access) by the total rural population x 100.
REC_USE_LIM: Source: Statistics Canada, 2021 Census of Population (with rounding). The aggregate totals were calculated based on the sum of values within the scope of analysis only (outside of population centres).

fr.DATA_COMP:
L'indice d'accès rural (IAR) est un pourcentage calculé en divisant la population rurale à 
moins de 2 kilomètres du réseau routier (avec accès) par la population rurale totale x 100.
fr.REC_USE_LIM:
Source : Statistique Canada, Recensement de la population de 2021 (avec arrondissements). 
Les totaux agrégés ont été basés sur la somme des valeurs faisant partie du cadre de l'analyse 
uniquement (à l'extérieur des centres de population).
